Dear Marc Christian Porter:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, LMSW

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1): An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c) Policies
and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and supervision,
methods for addressing residents’ needs, implementation of treatment
plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Camp Oakland Staff is having contact with youth via social media
platforms.
2

Investigation On 01/11/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A at his
home in Livonia. The DHHS specialist was also present for the
meeting. Youth A reported that he was posting on Instagram and Staff
1 responded to him about some work he had done on his car that he
posted. Youth A reported that Staff 1 responded to him via social
medial on 12/22/22 and 12/29/22. Youth A was able to show
screenshots of the conversations. The conversations between Youth A
and Staff 1 that was reviewed was not inappropriate in content. Youth
A reported that Staff 1 also direct messaged him when he was first
released from Camp Oakland. Youth A also reported that Staff 1 would
allow youth in the program to use her Bluetooth headphones and listen
to music. Youth A denied that he had any contact with Staff 1 during
his home pass. He reported that he told Youth B that Staff 1 follows
him on Instagram and that he was going to “hit” that when he gets out.
Youth A denied that he ever told other staff about social media contact
with Staff 1 or anything else that was going on.
On 01/11/23 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at the St. Clair
County DHHS office. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1
admitted that she had contact with Youth A and some other youth via
social media while still employed with Camp Oakland. Staff 1 denied
knowledge of other staff using social medial to contact youth in the
program. Staff 1 reported not knowing the name of the other youth that
she had contact with via social media. She reported that it had been
discussed in a previous investigation with DCWL and DHHS.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with the complainant.
No additional information or additional concerns were noted.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth C at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth C reported
that he was aware that Staff 1 had contact with some of the youth of
Camp Oakland. He reported that she would allow youth to add
themselves to her social media account so that she could have contact
with them. Youth C was unable to give specific names of youth that
she had added on social media. He denied that he had contact with
Staff 1 on social media.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth B at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth B reported
that he believed that Staff 2 has his contact number or social media
contact information. He also reported that Staff 2 has shown him stuff
that Youth A has posted on his social media page since he has been
released.
4

On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 2 reported that
Youth A asked Staff 1 for her snap-chat information and she provided it.
Staff 2 reported that he advised the supervisor, Staff 5, but is unaware
if anything ever came of it. He also reported that Staff 1 had social
media contact with a previous youth prior to their discharge and it was
investigated by DHHS and DCWL. Staff 2 reported that Youth A
contacted him via social media and was asking about what was
happening at Camp Oakland. He told him that he was contacted by the
police regarding Staff 1. Staff 2 admitted that he did have some
conversation with Youth 1 via social media. He reported that Youth A
then reported that Staff 1 was his “friend” and that he “hit it” the first day
he got out. Staff 2 said that he then blocked Youth A and reported that
information to his supervisor, Staff 5. He reported that he no longer
had the messages because he had blocked Youth A.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 4 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 4 reported that
a youth was bragging about having contact with Staff 1 on social media.
He reported that he had the youth log in on his phone and show him as
proof. Once he confirmed it, he reported that he advised Staff 5
because she was the supervisor. It was unclear if this incident was a
part of the initial investigation that was completed. Staff 4 was unable
to provide a clear timeline.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 5 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 5 reported that
she is a supervisor at Camp Oakland. She confirmed that Staff 2
reported to her that Youth A had reached out to him on social media
and said that he had sex with Staff 1. Staff 5 also confirmed that Staff 2
did not have an approved arrangement to have contact with the youth
via social media.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 6 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 6 reported that
he was speaking with Youth B and he reported that Youth A was having
contact with Staff 1 on social media. He also reported that Youth B
advised him that Youth A was “bragging” about having sex with Staff 1
and selling her Adderall. Staff 6 reported that he advised Staff 5 first
thing the next morning what had been reported to him and he was
advised to notify DHHS. Staff 6 reported that he heard others talk
about Staff 1 having contact with the youth on social media, but had no
firsthand knowledge himself.
On 01/31/2023 a DHHS case conference was held. DHHS reported
there were no confirmed accounts of abuse or neglect found.
4

On 01/19/2023 the employee file of Staff 1 was reviewed. A copy of the
communications policy, signed by Staff 1, was noted in the employee
file. No additional pertinent information was noted. The policy
documented that staff are not permitted to have contact with youth in
the program via social media.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation there was evidence to confirm that
more than one staff had contact with youth in the program in a manner
that was in violation of the agencies communication policy.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 (4a): R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to

Description Rule 112. (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When youth was placed at facility, they earned a home pass and spent
time away from the facility. During this pass time, youth met up with
one of the staff members from the facility and had sexual relations. The
staff member also provided youth with prescription Adderall.
Investigation On 01/05/2023 an in-person interview was held with Executive Director
(ED) of the agency. He advised that the Chief Administrator was not on
site but could be contacted via telephone. ED was advised of the
allegations. He confirmed the name of the staff involved in the
allegation. He also provided contact information and date of discharge
for Youth A.
On 01/11/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A at his
home in Livonia. The DHHS specialist was also present for the
meeting. Youth A reported that Staff 1 does not do her job well. He
reported that he would come out of the shower and flex with his shorts
and boxers on and Staff 1 would not say anything. He also stated that
he would sit next to her and say things and she would smile and giggle
and not redirect him. He denied that he ever felt uncomfortable around
Staff 1. Youth A admitted that he made statements about “getting with”
Staff 1 that were not true in order to impress other youth in the
program. He denied that he ever provided Staff 1 with prescription
drugs or got prescription drugs from her. He also denied drug use and
4

stated he got drug tested after returning from a home pass and never
tested positive.
On 01/11/23 an in-person interview was held with Mother of Youth A.
She denied that there were times during his home pass that he was
without supervision of her, his brother or another adult.
On 01/11/23 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at the St. Clair
County DHHS office. The DHHS specialist was also present. She
confirmed that she was no longer employed by Camp Oakland. She
reported that she had transitioned to a contingent staff but stopped
picking up shifts because it became stressful, and she began to
develop anxiety from the job. Staff 1 denied having any disciplinary
action in her case file. She also denied that she met up with Youth A
when he was on a home pass or outside of Camp Oakland. Staff 1
denied that she is prescribed or has access to Adderall. She reported
that she has been clean from meth for 8 years. She denied that Youth
A made sexually inappropriate statements toward her or had sexually
inappropriate contact with her. She also denied that Youth A told her
that he intended to have sex with her after he was released from Camp
Oakland. Staff 1 reported that she would redirect Youth A and other
youth in the program if they would make inappropriate comments. Staff
1 denied having any concerns regarding other staff’s interactions with
the youth in the program.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with the complainant.
No additional information or additional concerns were noted.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth C at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth C reported
that he and Youth A became close friends while they both were at
Camp Oakland. He denied that Youth A told him that he had met up
with Staff 1 while he was on a home pass. Youth C reported that he felt
like Staff 1 would “flirt” with the male youth. He stated, “it’s not what
she was saying, but how she was saying it’. He also reported that one
time between Thanksgiving and Christmas he saw Staff 1 allow a youth
to use her phone to get on social media. He reported that the youth
also asked Staff 1 when she was going to let him “hit it” and she
responded, “you can hit it when you get out”.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth B at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth B denied
seeing any inappropriate actions between Youth A and Staff 1. He
reported that Youth A told him that he worked on his car when he was
home on his pass. He denied that Youth A told him he was having any
contact with Staff 1 or anyone else that he should not.
4

On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 2 reported that
he has observed Staff 1 while on shift when she seemed to be “pushing
boundaries” with Youth A. Staff 2 reported that he was advised by Staff
6 that he had some concerns, and a report was made to DHHS. He
also reported that he had overheard youth say that they were having
contact with Staff 1 outside of the agency and bragging about
inappropriate sexual contact. Staff 2 reported that he saw Staff 1
provide her cell phone to youth for use.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 3 reported that
he heard reports and rumors about things that may have happened
between Staff B and youth in the program. He denied ever seeing Staff
1 be inappropriate with the youth or give them her phone. He reported
that he only worked with Staff 1 on two occasions.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 4 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 4 denied any
knowledge of inappropriate sexual contact between Staff 1 and any
youth in the program. He also denied that any youth or Staff 1 had
reported exchange of Adderall or other drugs to him. Lastly, he denied
that Youth A ever had positive screens upon return from his home pass
and denied any concerns when working with Staff 1.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 5 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. She stated that after
getting information from some of the youth and staff she became
concerned and advised staff to make appropriate calls to DHHS. She
reported that she reviewed the record of Youth A and noted that he was
not prescribed Adderall. She denied that she spoke with Youth A
regarding the allegations. She reported that she attempted to contact
Staff 1 to discuss, but she failed to respond. Staff 5 reported that once
the concerns were expressed about Staff 1, she was taken off the
schedule and did not return. She confirmed that Staff 1 is no longer
employed with the agency.
On 01/19/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 6 at Camp
Oakland. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 6 reported that
he observed Staff 1 engage in playful gestures with the youth that
seemed to be inappropriate boundaries. He advised that he made his
supervisor, Staff 5, aware of his concerns.
On 01/31/2023 a DHHS case conference was held. DHHS reported
there were no confirmed accounts of abuse or neglect found.
4

On 01/19/2023 the employee file of Staff 1 was reviewed. A copy of the
communications policy, signed by Staff 1, was noted in the employee
file. No additional pertinent information was noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was no evidence to support
violation of licensing rule 400.4112. Both Youth A and Staff 1 denied
having sexual contact and any exchange of prescription medication.
Additional youth and staff interviewed also denied any knowledge of
sexual contact or exchange of prescription medication.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the that
the current license status be continued.
